intro: Calyptranthes acevedoi, commonly known as the Acevedo's calyptranthes, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
